prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: A freelance photojournalist who I've met in the past. Known for her ability to sniff out scoops and snap them with her trusty camera.
Character 2
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 3
Name: Di-Jun Wang
Description: President of Zheng Fa, and the victim in this case. His body was found on a film set.
Character 4
Name: Crew Member
Description: A props person at Global Studios, and the first to discover the body. Her name is Penny Nichols.
Character 5
Name: Shaun Fenn
Description: The child star of the monster movie being filmed. Mature for his age with a menacing demeanor.
Character 6
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A judge, and a member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence. Suspected of being involved in the president's murder.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 8
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co. Acting as Fifi Laguarde's attorney in place of Rosie Ringer.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. She is a highly talented prosecutor, and is currently working with Interpol.
Character 10
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who thinks he's a real winner. Ran off in shock after discovering that his father is a criminal.
Character 11
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: A former prison warden. She is currently on trial for the murder of Bronco Knight.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Character 13
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: An animal-tamer-in-training at the Berry Big Circus. He came to watch the trial.
Character 14
Name: Will Powers
Description: An action star with Global Studios. He's playing the part of Taurusaurus in the movie that's currently being shot.
Character 15
Name: Tabby Lloyd
Description: A journalist who's always on the lookout for a scoop. Protégé of Lotta Hart.
Character 16
Name: Excelsius Winner
Description: Chairman of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence and the ringleader behind the underground auction. He is currently under arrest for murder.
Character 17
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: One of President Wang's bodyguards. Murdered while being held at the detention center.
Character 18
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin who escaped from prison three nights ago. His whereabouts are currently unknown.
Character 19
Name: Shelly de Killer
Description: A professional killer who made an attempt on President Wang's life at Gourd Lake.
Character 20
Name: Alf Aldown
Description: A freelance journalist who was murdered in the incident from 12 years ago.
Character 21
Name: Rosie Ringer
Description: A member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence. She was killed while attempting to avenge Alf Aldown.
Character 22
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A high school student looking to become a forensic investigator, and the younger sister of my former boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Yatagarasu Pin
Description: The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears. The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears. There was a bug hidden inside.
Evidence 1
Name: Forged Letter
Description: A letter written by an unknown person claiming to be Kay. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Bigg Building
Description: Site of the underground auctions. There is an entrance to the hidden fifty-first floor on the roof.
Evidence 3
Name: Creature Feature Flyer
Description: Latest in the series after a twelve-year hiatus: "Taurusaurus Vs. Gourdy".
Evidence 4
Name: Movie Set Locks
Description: The combination lock on the front gate was left untouched, while the side gate's chain was cut sometime last night.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes → President Wang's Autopsy Report
Description: Surrounded by shards of concrete. Flecks of something yellow stuck to clothes. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Monster Footprints
Description: The concrete was broken and the earth exposed. But are they really footprints? The concrete was broken and the earth exposed. Did Excelsius Winner dig up the ransom money? The concrete was broken and the earth exposed after Excelsius Winner dug up President Wang's corpse.
Evidence 7
Name: Taurusaurus Head
Description: Modeled on the first generation Taurusaurus design. Seems like it fell from the roof of the on-set production trailer last night.
Evidence 8
Name: Taurusaurus Plushie
Description: Belonged to President Wang. It can record and play back sound.
Evidence 9
Name: Behind-the-Scenes Photo
Description: Photo taken yesterday. No monster footprints and no body were visible at that point.
Evidence 10
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle in front of the elevator on the roof of the Bigg Building. Shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle arriving on the roof of the Bigg Building. There's no footage of the president riding the elevator down to leave.
Evidence 11
Name: Ms. Hart's Statement
Description: Ms. Hart was in the 51st-floor storeroom the night before last, but didn't see the president pass through.
Evidence 12
Name: Shaun's Rehearsal Tape
Description: Filmed yesterday evening. Shows Shaun rehearsing by a monster footprint.
Evidence 13
Name: Blue Truck
Description: Parked in front of the Bigg Building. Driver is nowhere to be found.
Evidence 14
Name: Mechanic's Gloves
Description: Meant for motorcycle maintenance, but currently covered in dirt for some reason. Excelsius Winner wore these when digging the monster footprints.
Evidence 15
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 16
Name: Report on Knight
Description: A report from Warden Laguarde to Chairman Winner about the connection between Knight and Kanis.
Evidence 17
Name: Knight's Possessions
Description: A pocket chess set and a ring. Found in the safe in the auction storeroom. A pocket chess set and a ring Knight made from his father's signature stamp.
Evidence 18
Name: Bug
Description: The person in the red raincoat planted this inside Kay's Yatagarasu pin.
Evidence 19
Name: Ms. Lloyd's Tape
Description: A recording of signals that were intercepted from the bug that was planted in Kay's pin.
Evidence 20
Name: Bouquet
Description: A bouquet of lion lilies given to President Wang by Judge Gavèlle. Recovered from on top of his body by Shaun.
Evidence 21
Name: Sedative
Description: Used on both Kay and Shaun during their kidnapping. Brand name is "3 Zs".
Evidence 22
Name: SS-5 Incident Case File
Description: 12-year-old incident in which President Wang was kidnapped and the sole witness was murdered. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 23
Name: Fire
Description: One of the children set the orphanage yard on fire as a prank sometime during the evening before the incident.
Evidence 24
Name: Mr. Aldown's Autopsy Report
Description: Victim was struck on the head and died at around 1 AM on February 10th.
Evidence 25
Name: Mr. Aldown's Final Call
Description: Message left on Rosie Ringer's phone detailing what Aldown saw.
Evidence 26
Name: Bloody Button
Description: Found clutched in Aldown's right hand. The blood is his.
Evidence 27
Name: Mr. Aldown's Photograph
Description: Shows the president being kidnapped. Only one picture was taken. Touch the Check Button for details. Staged photograph taken after Aldown was killed. Touch the Check Button for details.
Evidence 28
Name: Victim's Shoes
Description: Not actually Aldown's shoes. They appear to have been placed on his feet by the culprit after the murder took place.
Evidence 29
Name: Mysterious Blood Stain
Description: Left on the scene of the murder 12 years ago. The blood wasn't Aldown's.
Evidence 30
Name: Child's Drawing
Description: A picture drawn by the child who caused the fire during the incident 12 years ago. It depicts what he saw the night of the incident.
Evidence 31
Name: Correspondence Chess Diagram
Description: Sent to Bronco Knight by Bodhidharma Kanis. Printed rather than hand-written. Letter from Kanis retyped by the mastermind, and then sent on to Bronco Knight.
Evidence 32
Name: Lion Hot Air Balloon
Description: Smaller balloon used for promotional purposes. Saint is in charge of it and drives it around on the back of a truck.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Listen up. That woman met with the president on top of the Bigg Building.
Person: Lang
Testimony 1
Testimony: Two nights ago, she pushed the president off the roof, and he fell onto this film lot.
Person: Lang
Testimony 2
Testimony: At the time, there was no one else on the rooftop, aside from those two.
Person: Lang
Testimony 3
Testimony: There's no room for doubt! That woman murdered the president!
Person: Lang

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to pick one pair that contradicts.

First, I'll go through the testimonies. The only testimony here is from Testimony 0 to Testimony 3 by character Shi-Long Lang (Character 2). The key points from his testimonies are:

- Testimony 0: The woman (Judge Gavelle, perhaps?) met with the president on the Bigg Building rooftop.
- Testimony 1: She pushed him off, causing his death on the film lot.
- Testimony 2: Only the two were there at the time.
- Testimony 3: No doubt, she's guilty.

Now, looking at the evidences, I need to find any that conflict with these statements. Let's go through the relevant evidences related to the scene and alibis.

Evidence 10 is Security Camera Footage. Its description says it shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle on the roof's elevator, but there's no footage of the president leaving via the elevator. If the camera footage exists, it might contradict the claim that only the two were there, or maybe the timing. But more importantly, if the president was on the roof with Gavèlle but didn't take the elevator down, that supports Lang's testimony that she pushed him off. Wait, but the testimony says she pushed him off the roof, so the death scene is the film lot, which is the location below. But the evidence about the crime scene notes (Evidence 5) mentions the body was surrounded by concrete shards and yellow flecks. Not sure if that's relevant here.

Looking at Evidence 9: Behind-the-Scenes Photo. It shows no footprints or body the day before. But the murder happened the night before last, so the photo might show the scene before the murder. Not directly conflicting.

Evidence 6: Monster Footprints. The description says the concrete was broken, but it's unclear if they're real. The note says Excelsius Winner dug up the corpse, which might mean the footprints were fabricated. If the footprints were made after the murder, maybe to frame someone else, that could conflict.

Wait, Evidence 10's Security Camera Footage shows Judge Gavèlle and the president on the roof but no footage of him leaving. If Lang claims she pushed him off the roof, then the body should be found on the film lot below. But the autopsy (Evidence 5) says the president was surrounded by concrete shards. Maybe the body was moved? Or perhaps the Security Camera doesn't show him leaving, but if he was pushed, he should have fallen. The camera might not have captured the actual push, but if the footage stops before that, it's possible. However, the key contradiction might be in Evidence 10's note that there's no footage of the president leaving via the elevator, which supports that he was pushed off, aligning with Lang's testimony.

Wait another angle: Evidence 11 is Ms. Hart's Statement. She was in the 51st-floor storeroom the night before last and didn't see the president pass through. If the president was on the roof with Gavèlle, perhaps they entered via another route, but if the storeroom is part of the path, then her statement that she didn't see him might not conflict directly.

Evidence 7: Taurusaurus Head fell from the roof's trailer. If the head fell, maybe it's part of the scene setup, but not directly related.

Wait, looking at Evidence 6 again: The description says the concrete was broken and earth exposed. The note says Excelsius Winner dug up the ransom money or the corpse. If the footprints were made by someone digging after the murder, then the scene was altered. If Lang says the president was pushed off the roof, leading to the film lot, but the actual body was found in a place that was tampered with (like moved there after being killed elsewhere), that would contradict. But the evidence about the footprints might suggest the scene was staged, implying the murder happened elsewhere. For example, if the president was killed in the storeroom and then moved to the film lot with fabricated footprints, then Lang's testimony about the push off the roof would be wrong. 

Alternatively, Evidence 10's Security Camera shows they were on the roof but didn't see him leaving via elevator. That supports the idea he was pushed off the roof, so that aligns with Lang's testimony. Hmm.

Wait, looking at Evidence 9: The behind-the-scenes photo from the day before shows no footprints or body. So the murder must have happened after that photo was taken. But if the murder was the night before last, and the photo was taken yesterday (the day before the murder?), then maybe timing is off. Not sure.

Wait, the key contradiction might be between Testimony 2 ("no one else on the rooftop aside from those two") and Evidence 10's Security Camera Footage. If the footage only shows them arriving but not leaving, does it imply others were present? Or maybe the camera doesn't capture everything, so we can't confirm. Alternatively, if there were others present but not captured, but that's speculative.

Wait, looking at Evidence 4: Movie Set Locks. The side gate's chain was cut. If someone else entered through the side gate, that would contradict Testimony 2's claim that only the two were there. But the evidence doesn't mention who cut it or when. If the side gate was forced open, maybe someone else was there. But without more info, it's hard to say.

Wait, another evidence: Evidence 12 is Shaun's Rehearsal Tape, showing him rehearsing by a monster footprint yesterday evening. The murder was the night before last. If the rehearsal was yesterday (the day before the murder?), then the footprint was there before the murder, which might not conflict. But the murder happened the night before last, so the footprint could have been there already. Not sure.

Wait, perhaps Evidence 6's note that Excelsius Winner dug the footprints. If the footprints were made by Winner after the murder, then the scene was altered. The president's body was found where Winner dug, implying he was killed elsewhere and moved. Thus, Lang's testimony that she pushed him off the roof (leading to the film lot) would be wrong because the actual death might have been elsewhere. So Evidence 6's description that the footprints were dug by Winner to plant evidence would contradict Lang's claim that the murder was a push from the roof, as the body's location was staged.

Alternatively, if the president was pushed off the roof, the body would be at the base of the building, but if the footprints and scene were altered, maybe the real cause of death was different. 

Alternatively, Evidence 10's Security Camera shows they were on the roof, but if the camera doesn't show the president leaving, maybe he was killed there, but then moved. The testimony says he was pushed off, so the body should be at the base. But if the camera is on the roof, maybe the body wasn't found there. The autopsy (Evidence 5) mentions the body was surrounded by concrete shards, which might be the film set's ground. If pushed from the roof, the body would land there. So that aligns. 

Hmm, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 2 (no one else present) and Evidence 4 (side gate was cut, implying someone else entered). If the side gate was cut, that suggests another person was there, contradicting Testimony 2. But the evidence doesn't explicitly state that the cut was made during the time of the murder. It just says it was cut sometime last night. If the murder happened last night, then yes, the side gate being cut implies someone else entered, contradicting Testimony 2's claim that only the two were present. 

Alternatively, if the side gate was cut by the president or Gavèlle themselves, but that's unlikely. The cut chain suggests an intruder. 

So, if Evidence 4 indicates that someone else entered through the side gate, then Testimony 2's assertion that only the two were there is contradicted. 

Wait, but the Testimony is about the rooftop meeting. The side gate is on the movie set, which might be a different location. The murder scene is on the film lot (the movie set?), so maybe the entrance via side gate is relevant. 

Alternatively, the Security Camera (Evidence 10) shows they were on the roof but not leaving via elevator. If they were pushed off, they wouldn't use the elevator. So that's consistent. 

Hmm, perhaps the strongest contradiction is between Evidence 10's Security Camera not showing the president leaving via elevator (so he must have been pushed off, which aligns with Testimony 1). But then where's the contradiction?

Wait, looking again at the testimonies: Testimony 1 says she pushed him off the rooftop, leading to death on the film lot. Evidence 5's Autopsy Report says he was surrounded by concrete shards. If the film lot is where he fell, that matches. 

Wait, maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 2's claim that no one else was present and Evidence 10's Security Camera not capturing him leaving. If the camera was on the roof, and they were there, but he didn't take the elevator down, that supports the push theory. But maybe the camera didn't capture the actual push, but the absence of others in the footage would align with Testimony 2. 

Hmm, maybe I'm overcomplicating. Let me check other evidences. 

Evidence 14: Mechanic's Gloves, used by Excelsius Winner to dig the footprints. If Winner was there, that means he was present on the rooftop or film set, contradicting Testimony 2's assertion that only the two were there. 

Ah, yes! Testimony 2 says only the president and Judge Gavèlle were present. But Evidence 14 says Excelsius Winner was there (since he wore the gloves to dig the footprints). Therefore, Excelsius was present, contradicting Testimony 2. 

So the contradiction is between Evidence 14 and Testimony 2. 

Wait, the Testimony is from Lang, who is Interpol. He says only the two were there. But Evidence 14 shows Excelsius was there, so that's a contradiction. 

Therefore, the answer should be evidence 14 and testimony 2.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by looking at the provided evidence and testimonies.

First, the testimonies from Lang (Character 2) are the ones to focus on since they're the only ones listed here. The key points from each testimony:

Testimony 0: A photo was taken 10-20 minutes after the president went up with the woman (Judge Gavèlle). 
Testimony 1: The woman came back down alone on the elevator.
Testimony 2: The president didn't get on the elevator, implying he was pushed off the roof.
Testimony 3: The president couldn't leave the roof without the elevator, so the only option was being pushed.
Testimony 4: Concludes that the woman pushed him off.

Now, looking at the evidence, especially those related to the scene and the elevator. Evidence 10 is the Security Camera Footage. Its description says it shows President Wang and Judge Gavèlle arriving on the roof, but there's no footage of the president riding the elevator down. That supports the idea he didn't leave via elevator, which aligns with Testimony 2 and 4's claim that he was pushed off.

Wait, but Testimony 1 says the woman came back down alone on the elevator. If the president didn't get on the elevator (as per the footage), that's consistent. Hmm, maybe another evidence contradicts?

Looking at Evidence 9: Behind-the-Scenes Photo taken yesterday (presumably the day of the murder) shows no monster footprints or body. That might be about the scene's state but not directly about the elevator.

Wait, Evidence 6 talks about Monster Footprints being made after Excelsius Winner dug up the corpse. That might be about the scene setup but not the elevator.

Wait, let's check Testimony 3 again. Lang says the president couldn't leave the roof without using the elevator. But maybe there's another way? Evidence 2 mentions the Bigg Building has a hidden 51st floor entrance on the roof. Maybe that's an alternative exit? But the testimony says the only way down is the elevator. If there's another entrance/exit, that contradicts the testimony.

Wait, the Security Camera Footage (Evidence 10) shows they arrived on the roof via elevator, but no footage of the president leaving. So according to the camera, he didn't take the elevator down, which matches the idea he was pushed off. But Testimony 1 says the woman came back alone on the elevator, which would mean she took the elevator down, but the president didn't. That's possible.

Wait, perhaps another evidence. Let's look at Evidence 11: Ms. Hart's Statement says she was in the 51st-floor storeroom the night before last and didn't see the president pass through. The 51st floor's entrance is on the roof (Evidence 2). If the president had gone through the 51st floor to exit, Ms. Hart might have seen him. Since she didn't, that supports he didn't use that route, reinforcing the testimony's point that the only exit was the elevator, which he didn't take, hence pushed off.

Hmm, maybe I'm missing something. Let's check Testimony 3 again: Lang says the president couldn't get down without the elevator. But if there's another way via the 51st floor entrance, then that's a contradiction. The testimony assumes the elevator is the only exit, but the building's structure (Evidence 2) has another access point.
